events.message: The applicant submitted the personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses after receiving preliminary guidance from customer service.
Loan application reviewed and categorised under personal loans due to references of medical bills and debt consolidation needs in the submitted forms.
A loan officer was assigned to the personal loan application to ensure close management throughout the approval process.
Conducted an initial review to verify application completeness and initial eligibility parameters including income verification.
Requested supporting documents such as recent pay stubs, medical bills, and identification to proceed with final assessment.
Applicant promptly submitted all requested medical bills, income statements, and government-issued ID to support the loan application.
Credit report received and analyzed showing a moderate credit score with some outstanding debts related to prior medical expenses.
Risk evaluation completed factoring in credit score, debt-to-income ratio, and purpose of loan related to medical debt.
Personal loan offer including repayment terms and interest rate was presented to applicant via email and secure portal notification.
Applicant responded positively to the loan terms, requesting minor clarification on repayment start date and monthly installment amounts.
Application escalated to credit manager for review due to applicant’s request for modified repayment schedule and clarification.
Loan manager approved the personal loan with adjusted repayment terms accommodating the applicant’s feedback and financial situation.
Approved loan amount was disbursed successfully to the applicant’s designated bank account for covering the medical bills and debt payments.
Follow-up call confirmed applicant satisfaction with the loan process and repayment plan after one month of funding.
Closed the loan application file after successful funding and positive follow-up, marking the case as complete and serviced.
